pr_title: Use valueOf instead of primitive wrapper constructors

timeline.message:
Use valueOf instead of primitive wrapper constructors

Search and replace of `new PrimitiveType(` with `PrimitiveType.valueOf(`

Fixes: #10937

[ci skip]

Signed-off-by: Graham Chapman <graham_chapman@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: Any requirement for these to be unique objects?  valueOf will use the Integer cache where new Integer wouldn't
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: This probably does change the sense of the test, but this test is pretty useless these days, and continues to pass with these changes.
replies.author: gacholio

replies.bodyText: Changing them to new Object() is potentially giving our selves more work in the future considering that Object may become an abstract class. For these sort of things where we need a ref type but dont really care what kind we should just define a static inner class.
replies.author: tajila

timeline.bodyText: Similar concern about caching of Boolean.valueOf() and changing the test as the lifetime of the Boolean is now much longer
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: There's only one use here, so I don't think it matters.
replies.author: gacholio

replies.bodyText: Only 1 use in this test but are you sure no other code in the class library is using Boolean.valueOf(false)?  The PhantomRef presumable will indicate when the bool has been collected and that may never happen due to using a cached version,
replies.author: DanHeidinga

timeline.bodyText: Same concern about extended life time here
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText:
I've never understood what phantom does - aside from the potentially cached object, this test appears broken in two other ways:

using sleep is extremely unreliable
the bool variable is never set to null, so there's no guarantee it won't be collected even without the caching
replies.author: gacholio

timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: Single use, and realistically, no one is caching 667.
replies.author: gacholio

timeline.message:
Use valueOf instead of primitive wrapper constructors

Search and replace of `new PrimitiveType(` with `PrimitiveType.valueOf(`

Fix the vich test so that it continues to ensure 32 unique objects.

timeline.bodyText: Hopefully this comment is no longer true: Perhaps it should be deleted?
timeline.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText: This was an optimization that was made when we switched from the native implementation to the Java implementation as the Java implementation was more "JIT friendly". Perhaps @andrewcraik knows if this is still the case.
replies.author: tajila

replies.bodyText: If nothing else, it should be changed to match the pattern of the rest of the code.
replies.author: gacholio

replies.bodyText: I do not know if this is still the case - that conversion happened quite a long time ago. The code would need to be benchmarked to know if the change to Byte.valueOf is performance neutral and if bypassing the Byte cache still yields a performance boost. I think any decision to change this needs perf testing since it was clearly important and so we need to verify the best way to handle the operations. Doing the new directly could allow for stack allocation when valueof may not (due to the cache pathways). I am not sure why the optimization was only applied in this specific case, but it being different is not sufficient to warrant a change without perf evaluation IMO.
replies.author: andrewcraik
